channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: The world's largest steel industry is going through a 'winter' amid a supply glut and weak demand
item.description: The Chinese steel industry is caught "between a rock and a hard place" as steel makers' margins are getting increasingly squeezed by weak demand, Bank of America executive said.

item.title: China's antimony export controls rattle the tungsten industry
item.description: New export controls have shaken the critical minerals industry. Insiders are worried that Beijing will leverage its global supply chain dominance in unprecedented ways.

item.title: JD.com leads losses in Hong Kong, falling 10% after Walmart confirms stake sale
item.description: Walmart said the decision will allow it to "focus on our strong China operations for Walmart China and Sam's Club, and deploy capital towards other priorities."

item.title: EV company Nio aims to build battery chargers and swap stations in every Chinese county
item.description: Chinese electric car company Nio said Tuesday it plans to install battery charging stations in every one of China's 2,844 counties by the end of June 2025.

item.title: Shein sues Temu over copyright infringement, alleges rival loses money on every sale
item.description: Chinese-linked fast-fashion leader Shein is suing Temu, alleging its rival stole its designs and trade secrets.

item.title: Obama says 'America is ready for a new chapter' with Harris, Walz
item.description: Barack Obama, who preceded Donald Trump in the White House, praised President Joe Biden, who served as his vice president.

item.title: European Union slashes planned tariffs on China-made Tesla EVs, other Chinese firms
item.description: The European Union on Tuesday said a planned tariff on Tesla vehicles being imported from China would be cut to 9% from 20.8%.

item.title: Mpox is 'not the new Covid' and the disease can be stopped, WHO director says
item.description: Mpox is "not the new Covid" and the risk to the general population is low, according to the WHO's regional director for Europe.

item.title: 'The World' is a luxury ship that travels the world full time — here's how much an apartment on it costs
item.description: A resident explains the pros and cons of living on "The World" — a luxury ship with privately owned apartments.

item.title: Michelle Obama: Trump used 'misogynistic, racist lies' to 'try to make people fear us'
item.description: Michelle Obama drew explicit contrasts between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

item.title: Beyoncé launches whiskey line with LVMH's Moët Hennessy
item.description: As Moët Hennessy expands in the American whiskey market, SirDavis also serves to honor Beyoncé's heritage.

item.title: Morgan Stanley International chair among 6 missing after luxury yacht sinks in Sicily
item.description: The 56-meter (184 feet) sailing boat, called "The Bayesian," was hit by a violent storm around 4 a.m. local time Monday with 10 crew and 12 passengers on board.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: 'Crazy' summer
item.description: Wall Street ends longest winning streak of 2024. Eli Lilly weight loss drug cuts diabetes risk. Shein sues Temu.

item.title: OpenAI announces content deal with Condé Nast, including content from Wired, The New Yorker and Vogue
item.description: OpenAI on Tuesday announced a partnership with Condé Nast, in which the startup's products, such as ChatGPT and SearchGPT, will be able to display its content.

item.title: Global commodities' biggest winners and losers this year — and where they're headed
item.description: The global commodities market has had a volatile year thus far, with prices remaining largely elevated.

item.title: Proposed 7-Eleven buyout deal will likely face antitrust scrutiny, retail analyst says
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard's proposal to buyout 7-Eleven owner Seven & i Holdings Co., would likely attract antitrust scrutiny, says retail analyst.

item.title: Amazon-backed Anthropic hit with class-action lawsuit over copyright infringement
item.description: Anthropic, the Amazon-backed AI startup, on Monday was hit with a class-action lawsuit in California federal court over alleged copyright infringement.

item.title: 'Britain's Bill Gates': Who is Mike Lynch, the UK tech entrepreneur missing after superyacht sinks?
item.description: Mike Lynch was only recently cleared of fraud charges in a landmark trial. Now, in a shock turn of events, he's gone missing after the sinking of a superyacht.

item.title: U.S., China sign agreement to cooperate on financial stability
item.description: The U.S. and China last week signed agreements for cooperating on financial stability, according to a People's Bank of China readout Monday.

item.title: Eli Lilly's weight loss drug slashes the risk of developing diabetes in long-term trial
item.description: The late-stage trial on tirzepatide also found that patients experienced sustained weight loss over the roughly three-year treatment period.

item.title: GMC expects to outsell its electric truck competitors as it launches new Sierra pickup
item.description: To do so, it will have to top its sibling Chevrolet Silverado EV as well as competitors from Ford Motor, Rivian Automotive and Tesla.

item.title: Waymo says it has doubled its weekly paid robotaxi trips to 100,000 since May
item.description: After Alphabet invested another $5 billion in Waymo, the robotaxi venture is hitting new milestones.

item.title: Brits snap up lower mortgage deals as Bank of England rate cut boosts property market
item.description: Britain's biggest high street lenders are continuing to slash borrowing costs after the Bank of England's first interest rate cut in four year sparked a boom in homebuyer activity.

item.title: How the Inflation Reduction Act sparked a manufacturing and clean energy boom in the U.S.
item.description: The IRA has had a transformative impact on U.S. manufacturing, according to the Rhodium Group.

item.title: European stocks close lower as market uncertainty lingers; Sweden's Riksbank cuts rates
item.description: European stocks closed lower Tuesday afternoon as market uncertainty over the economic outlook lingers.

item.title: Gold set for fresh highs ahead of Fed rate decision — analysts see prices at $3,000 by next year
item.description: Gold prices have reached multiple highs this year, with more to come as the next U.S. Federal Reserve meeting draws closer.

item.title: Beijing and Hollywood are decoupling as Chinese audiences favor domestic productions
item.description: After years of strong showings in China's box office, Hollywood films are being pushed out by homegrown blockbusters in the massive movie market.

item.title: Boeing pauses tests of 777X aircraft after finding damage to one of the jets' structures
item.description: It wasn't immediately clear how the grounding would affect certification and delivery of the new 777X aircraft.

item.title: Singapore introduces measures to cool the public housing market
item.description: The loan-to-value limit for Housing Development Board loans has been lowered from 80% to 75%, the government said.

item.title: 'Travel is too expensive right now': Americans are spending less or skipping trips altogether
item.description: After two years of strong gains, demand for leisure trips is starting to dip as travelers pull back on travel spending.
